title: Costco: Value For Customers But Not For Investors
text: Costco's incremental growth acceleration is driven only by new warehouse expansions as same-warehouse-sales growth is constant. This can lead to an erosion in return profiles. Stock price appreciation over the last 2 years has been driven mostly by a 42% multiple expansion with minimal earnings growth. Yet, the growth profile now is weaker. Costco deserves a premium valuation vs its peers. However, I believe a 168% premium to the median 1-yr fwd PE is excessive.
